questions.text: A 30-Year-old G2P1 female was admitted with labour pain to a tertiary care centre. She delivered a male fetus of 3.5 kg. After the delivery of the baby, the obstetrician explains to you the importance of active management of the third stage of labour. Which of the following is considered to be the most important step in AMTSL?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Uterotonic drugs Active management of labour includes Administration of a uterotonic soon after the birth of baby Delayed cord clamping Delivery of placenta by controlled cord traction Uterine massage In the AMTSL guidelines, the most important step is the administration of uterotonic agents like oxytocin (most important), misoprostol and ergots majorly along with other substitutes. All other options are also components of AMTSL but their importance in comparison to uterotonic is limited .

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Uterine tone assessment is important to know the cause of the PPH if it is atony. In other words, normal tone rules out atonic PPH , and we should look for other causes. Option: B. controlled cord traction does lower the manual placenta removal rates and shorten the third stage of labour but is less effective to prevent haemorrhage compared to medical management. Option: D . Delayed cord clamping- it does not raise postpartum haemorrhage rates, and the early component is of less importance now. And it also gives the benefit of extra blood supplied to the fetus to prevent anaemia and other complications.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a part of AMTSL?

options.label: C
options.text: Use of oxytocin as 20 units in 1000 ml NS infusion

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Uterine massage For all practical purposes, early cord clamping is not a part of AMTSL. Uterine massage also has been recently removed from the management but is still practised . So in a question of which is not a part of AMTSL, the best answer is: early cord clamping > uterine massage > delayed cord clamping

Highyeild:

AMTSL components: 1.delayed cord clamping 2.Use of oxytocin as 20 units in 1000 ml NS infusion 3.Controlled cord traction

questions.text: The perineal tear should be repaired:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Immediately Management of Perineal tears: The recent tear should be repaired immediately following the delivery of the placenta. In cases of delay beyond 24 hours , the complete tear should be repaired after 3 months . Repair of first and second-degree tears: is similar to repair of episiotomy . Repair of third and fourth-degree tears: Their repair is of prime importance as uncorrected tears may lead to faecal incontinence . The rectal mucosa is first repaired followed by the disrupted ends of the anal sphincter (both the internal and external sphincter). Then the remaining repair is carried out as in any other second-degree perineal tear.

questions.text: Several compounds are available for the use in prevention of PPH and AMTSL. Which of the following statements is not true regarding uterotonics?

options.label: A
options.text: WHO recommends oxytocin as a first line for prophylaxis at a dose of 20 units in 1000 ml of crystalloid solution.

options.label: B
options.text: In those without iv access. Im route is preferred as it is more effective than the iv route to prevent PPH

options.label: C
options.text: Carboprost is approved for uterine atony treatment in a dose of 250 micrograms given IM, which can result in S/E up to 20 per cent of women with diarrhoea, hypertension, vomiting, fever, flushing etc.

options.label: D
options.text: Carboprost should not be used in asthmatic women and suspected cases of amniotic fluid embolism.

questions.correct_answer: B. In those without iv access. Im route is preferred as it is more effective than the iv route to prevent PPH
questions.explanation:
Solution:

In those without iv access. Im route is preferred as it is more effective than the iv route to prevent PPH In those with no IV access , oxytocin can be given IM , but the IV route is more effective than IM to prevent PPH. NOTE: oxytocin is never given as an undiluted bolus dose because of a serious risk of hypotension or cardiac arrhythmias.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. WHO recommends oxytocin as a first line for prophylaxis at a dose of 20 units in 1000 ml of crystalloid solution. Option: C. Carboprost is approved for uterine atony treatment in a dose of 250 micrograms given IM . Option: D. Carboprost should not be used in asthmatic women and suspected cases of amniotic fluid embolism - as it causes pulmonary airway and vascular constriction.

questions.text: You as an OBG junior resident are attending A 24-year-old primigravida patient with POG 40 weeks, BMI- 32 kg/m2 with labour pain, she has a significant history of polyhydramnios in the 2nd trimester of this pregnancy. She delivered a male baby of 4 kg full term. After the delivery of the baby, the obstetrician notices a heavy amount of bleeding through the vaginal tract. she immediately increased the IV infusion rate of oxytocin but the bleeding continued. The placenta has been separated and removed completely. Which of the following steps should be in a particular sequence to treat the condition? Uterine massage Bimanual compression and balloon tamponade Hysterectomy Angiographic embolization. Compression sutures Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1,2,5,4,3 With the following clues, we can diagnose that the patient is in atonic PPH: h/o polyhydramnios in 2nd trimester of this pregnancy Male baby of 4kg full term.- large fetus BMI- 32kg/m2- obesity. Also, both primiparity and high parity are the risk factors for PPH

Highyeild:

The sequence of management of Atonic PPH is as follows: Initially, patients should be managed with uterotonics and uterine massage . When unresponsive to uterotonic agents, bimanual compression and balloon tamponade should be done to control haemorrhages. If the patient becomes stable , B lynch sutures are applied and uterine artery embolisation is done. If the patient is still not stable , ligation of arteries can be tried which, if still failed, can be followed by hysterectomy .
